text: [Laird] You know why I love surfing, Stan?
It's all about learning to let go.

You know, I fathered six kids in three
different countries.
I just let them all go.
[Stan] I can't let go.
I have to be responsible for my family.
If I let go, all hell would break loose.
[Laird] Stan, make me a promise.
The right wave is gonna come, dude.

And when it does, you're gonna let go of
your worries.
Just go with the flow.
Whenever.

There's one. Paddle! Paddle, Stan!
Now, now, now!
[Francine] Stan.
Hamburger buns were on sale, so I stole 600.

[Hayley] When I have a baby, I'm gonna name it
Recycling.

[Steve] Dad, me and my mysterious friend are blood
brothers now.

[Roger] Stan, fifa says the downstairs bathroom is
gonna need 70 urinals.
It'll work if we move the hamper.
[Laird] Remember, Stan.
Let go.
[Stan] I'm doing it.

Ah. 
[Laird] Looks like you're starting to get it.
[Stan] I feel so relaxed.
[Laird] Whoa! Is that a soul patch?

[Stan] Horatio. My son Steve is going to be working
with us for the summer.
[Horatio] Welcome aboard.
[Steve] Thanks.
[hand crunches] Ah!
What the hell?
[Stan] Ha ha. That Steve is a working man's handshake.

A locked wrist that says he stands strong by
his convictions, a firm grip that says you

can trust him, plenty of thick calluses that
show he's not afraid to persevere.
[Steve] Kind of like Shreck's hands.
[thud] Ah!
My tip.
[Stan] Your hands are the exact opposite.

But thankfully, a summer of hard work will
fix you right up.
[Horatio] Steve, you're in luck.
You started here at a good time.
Tomorrow is employee swim.
[Steve] Oh, is that where the girls ask the guys?
[Horatio] Uh.

Uh, no. Once a month, the club gives us an hour
early in the morning to swim in the pool
right before they drain it.
It's magic.
[Stan] Oof!
[Horatio] Oh, no.
[Stan] It's Vanderhill.
[Vanderhill] A bird distracted me on my back swing.
It was going geek geek geek!
That's not my name. And it was saying it right at me.
[both Stan and Horatio] Yes, Mr. Vanderhill.

[Vanderhill] I'm sure it was a
female.

Now go find its nest and smash its offspring
before I shoot you with my turd gun.
[shooting sounds] pt-a pt-a
[both Stan and Horatio] Yes, Mr. Vanderhill.
[Lewis] Vape pods.
One hitters.

Gold slugger I can't tell you how
disappointed I am in all of you.
Where's the good stuff?
I've got a flight to Cabo in 40 minutes.

[Steve] Principal Lewis has no right to invade our
privacy like this.

[Snot] Relax. We're gonna be lousy with privacy all
summer down at the hole.

[Billy] You guys got something special planned for
break?

[Steve] Snot and I spend every summer at a super
secret swimming hole outside town.

Just working on our slack shack, catching
fish and practicing make outs on a smooth log
we hauled out of a beaver dam.
[Billy] Can I come?

[Steve] Sorry, Billy. Not even Barry or Toshi know
about the old hole.
[Snot] And it's not on any map.
[Steve] Well, there's a lyrical map.

[Snot] That we vowed never to repeat in front of
other people.
[Steve] I could just hum you the melody.
[Billy] I'm good.

[Snot] Fine words and everything. 
♪ Down the dirt road to the knobbly old oak ♪

♪ Cross the shallows where the bullfrogs
croak ♪♪
[Lewis] Smith. What's with the fish?
[Klaus] I'm sorry, Steve.
I smuggled myself in your backpack.

The lunch lady throw a killer end of the
year party and make a timpano out of
everything that's left in the cafeteria.
Last year, there was a whole kid in there.
He was delicious.

[Lewis] Hmm. A fish that parties and isn't afraid to
bend the rules.
Good. You're with me.

I'm taking your pet as my emotional support 
animal.
Brrrrr-ing!

That's the bell. Lose yourself to the
summer b*****s.
[Hayley] Want to lay out and tan for a bit?
[Francine] Sure.

[Hayley] Hey, I have an idea for a film
adaptation of Hungry Hungry Hippos. You want to hear about it?
[Francine] Of course.

[Hayley] It's the year 3000 marbles are scarce and
hippos are used only for sex.
[Klaus] A giant freshwater lake.

I can finally ditch my ball and be free to
roam around wherever I please.
Freedom!
Hahahaha!
[chomp]
Oh, crap!
[crowd cheers] Go go go go go.
Go go go go go go go go.
[Stan] How much time left, Possum Dave?
[Dave] Two hours.
[Steve] Time to kick it into high gear.
[crowd] Go go go go.
[crowd continues] Go go go go.
[air horn blows]
[Dave] Stan and Steve are our winners!
[applause] Woo! Woo!
